_header: The fleshes lust may thou not alive better quench
_description: A tag in the Fasciculus morum — one couplet translating ‘Non aliter poterit melius caro viva domari/ Mortua qualis erit quam semper premeditari’ which precedes it

Bod410.Transcription:
the fflesch lust may þu not on lyue better qwenchbut after
                    þi deth what þu art euermore thench

BodLauMis111.Transcription:
þe flesches lust may þou noht on lyue beter quenchebot
                    after þi deth woth þou beȝ euer more þonche

BodRawC670.Transcription:
Þe flesches lust may þou nouȝt o lyue bettur
                    quencheBote aftur þy deth which þou beȝ euer more be
                    þenche
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 148.

CamGon71.Transcription:
þi flech lust may þu nogth better quenkþan of þi
                    dede euer more thenk

CamStJohn159.Transcription:
þi fleschly lust may þu no better wenchebot eftyr þi
                    dede day ay for to thenche

EDU82.Transcription:
Thy fflesly lustes may þu not on lyve better qwencheThen after
                    thy dethe wyche thou best euermore to thenche

Lincoln44.Transcription:
þe fluschly luste may þow nocht only bett qwencheBot of
                    þi dede þu euermore to þenke
